case_vignette:
A 35-year-old man with a past medical history of obesity and tobacco use presents to clinic with a seven month history of boils under the arms and in the groin. He reports that the boils come up twice a week under the arms, and once a week in the groin. The individual boils are painful and will often drain foul odorous yellow green material. Many of the boils have been drained in the emergency room.   Physical examination reveals multiple painful, tender subcutaneous nodules draining yellow-white malodorous pus in the bilateral axilla and inguinal folds. Scattered double headed comedones and sinus tracts are present. The patient is afebrile and has a normal white blood cell count. The patient is a 35-year-old individual with a past medical history of obesity and tobacco use presents to clinic with a seven month history of boils under the arms and in the groin. The individual reports that the boils come up twice a week under the arms, and once a week in the groin. The individual boils are painful and will often drain foul odorous yellow green material. Many of the boils have been drained in the emergency room.   Physical examination reveals multiple painful, tender subcutaneous nodules draining yellow-white malodorous pus in the bilateral axilla and inguinal folds. Scattered double headed comedones and sinus tracts are present. The patient is afebrile and has a normal white blood cell count.

Physical examination reveals multiple painful, tender subcutaneous nodules draining yellow-white malodorous pus in the bilateral axilla and inguinal folds. Scattered double headed comedones and sinus tracts are present. The person is afebrile and has a normal white blood cell count.
